trans-unit.source: The following steps show the process for creating a Dropbox app using the Dropbox.com site.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show the process for creating a Dropbox app using the Dropbox.com site.

trans-unit.source: As the Dropbox.com site may change without notice, you might see differences in UI from what is shown.
trans-unit.target: As the Dropbox.com site may change without notice, you might see differences in UI from what is shown.

trans-unit.source: Go to the [Dropbox developer portal](https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps), click **App Console**, and then click **Create App**.
trans-unit.target: Go to the [Dropbox developer portal](https://www.dropbox.com/developers/apps), click **App Console**, and then click **Create App**.

trans-unit.source: Choose **Dropbox API app** and configure the other settings.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Dropbox API app** and configure the other settings.

trans-unit.source: The file access options shown in the screenshot below will enable you to test access to your Dropbox account with a simple HTTP Get request if you have any files in your account.
trans-unit.target: The file access options shown in the screenshot below will enable you to test access to your Dropbox account with a simple HTTP Get request if you have any files in your account.

trans-unit.source: The name of the Dropbox API app can be anything the Dropbox site will accept.
trans-unit.target: The name of the Dropbox API app can be anything the Dropbox site will accept.

trans-unit.source: The next page shows the App key and App secret settings (named Client ID and Client secret in Azure) that you'll use for configuring your Azure Dropbox connector.
trans-unit.target: The next page shows the App key and App secret settings (named Client ID and Client secret in Azure) that you'll use for configuring your Azure Dropbox connector.

trans-unit.source: This page also has a field where you can enter a Redirect URI, the value of which you'll get in the next section.
trans-unit.target: This page also has a field where you can enter a Redirect URI, the value of which you'll get in the next section.
